meanings.definition: Relating to or derived from pyridine.
meanings.sent1: The pyridic compound showed a strong odor.
meanings.sent2: Her experiment involved the use of a pyridic solution.
meanings.sent3: The pyridic scent in the lab made everyone sneeze.
meanings.sent4: The night air was filled with a pyridic aroma.
meanings.sent5: The pyridic nature of the substance made it easy to identify.

meanings.sent1: The plant emitted a pyridic smell that attracted insects.
meanings.sent2: The liquid had a pyridic taste that lingered on the tongue.
meanings.sent3: The pyridic properties of the material surprised the researchers.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a pyridic quality that was soothing.
meanings.sent5: The pyridic characteristics of the fabric made it stand out.

meanings.sent1: The pyridic solution was carefully stored in a glass container.
meanings.sent2: The pyridic compound reacted strongly with the other chemicals.
meanings.sent3: The pyridic content of the mixture altered its color.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with a pyridic vapor that stung the eyes.
meanings.sent5: The pyridic ingredients in the recipe gave it a unique flavor.
